questions.question: What is the primary focus of Mobile Forensics?
options: Extracting data from smartphones, tablets, and wearable devices
questions.correct_answer: Extracting data from smartphones, tablets, and wearable devices

questions.question: Which of the following data types is commonly recovered in mobile forensics investigations?
Which tool is commonly used for mobile forensics?
Which of the following is a challenge in mobile forensics?
What is a common method for extracting data from mobile devices in forensics?
What does 'logical extraction' refer to in mobile forensics?
options: Extracting raw data from the device's memory
Extracting data from the file system of the mobile device
questions.correct_answer: Extracting data from the file system of the mobile device

questions.question: What does 'physical extraction' in mobile forensics involve?
options: Extracting the entire content of the mobile device's storage
Extracting app data from the device's file system
Extracting only call logs and messages
questions.correct_answer: Extracting the entire content of the mobile device's storage

questions.question: Which mobile operating system is most commonly examined in mobile forensics?
What type of data can be recovered from a mobile device during an investigation?
Which of the following is a mobile forensics tool used for extracting data from iOS devices?
What is the main advantage of 'over-the-air' (OTA) extraction in mobile forensics?
options: It is faster than USB-based extraction
It does not require user consent

questions.question: What does 'chip-off' extraction involve in mobile forensics?
options: Accessing the mobile device's memory chip directly
Forensically copying the device's storage to another device
questions.correct_answer: Accessing the mobile device's memory chip directly

questions.question: Which type of mobile device data can be the hardest to recover during an investigation?
Which of the following is NOT a type of mobile forensics extraction?
What is the significance of call logs in mobile forensics?
options: They can provide evidence of communications during a crime
They are not useful for forensic investigations
They are typically encrypted and cannot be retrieved
They are stored only in cloud backups
questions.correct_answer: They can provide evidence of communications during a crime

questions.question: What can 'app data' recovery provide in mobile forensics investigations?
Which is a common technique used to recover data from damaged mobile devices?
What does 'cloud extraction' refer to in mobile forensics?
options: Recovering data from the device's memory chip
Extracting data stored on cloud services linked to the mobile device
Accessing deleted files in the device's storage
questions.correct_answer: Extracting data stored on cloud services linked to the mobile device

questions.question: Which of the following is a legal concern during mobile forensics investigations?
options: Obtaining user consent for data extraction
Accessing encrypted data without proper authorization
Bypassing security measures without court orders

questions.question: Which of the following is a limitation of mobile forensics?
options: Data can be recovered from most devices without issues
Encrypted devices may block access to critical data
Cloud data extraction is always possible
Mobile device data is always backed up
questions.correct_answer: Encrypted devices may block access to critical data
